item.title: File Deleter
item.dc:creator: @Goodbye_RS_Hello_RSP Goodbye RS, Hello RSPS
item.description:
@Goodbye_RS_Hello_RSP wrote:

Please move this thread here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,25.0.html

[code]import java.io.File;

public class FileDeleter {
public static void main(String[] args) {
String directory = “test.txt”;
File f = new File(directory);
if (!f.exists())
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Delete: no such file or directory: " + directory);
if (!f.canWrite())
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Delete: write protected: "+ directory);
if (f.isDirectory()) {
String[] files = f.list();
if (files.length > 0)
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Delete: directory not empty: " + directory);
}

	boolean success = f.delete();

	if (!success) {
		throw new IllegalArgumentException("Delete: deletion failed");
	}
}

}[/code]

Set your directory, and your off.

A fully working Java File Deleter.

Read full topic
